full_summary:
=====================================

**Tender Announcement: Winter Abrasives Production**
---------------------------------------------------

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01029551
**Publication Date:** March 9, 2023
**Closing Date:** March 23, 2023, at 4:00 PM MST
**URL of Notice:** Not available
**Attachments:** Available on Canada BUs Canad [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/03/17/a6302efcc547974a7409035d339d926b/e_-_amend_1_23-0016.pdf)

**Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify
**Method of Procurement:** Competitive - Open Bidding
**End User Entity:** Parks Canada
**Contracting Authority:?** Jennifer Maheu, **Email:** [jennifer.maheu@pc.gc.ca](mailto:jennifer.maheu@pc.gc.ca), **Phone:** 587-432-8458
**Regions of Opportunity:** Canada
**Regions of Delivery:** Alberta

**Bidders’ Conference:**
------------------------

A bidders' conference will be held on March 16, 2023, via teleconference at 10:00 AM PST. This conference will provide an overview of the project requirements and will address questions. Participation is recommended for bidders who intend to submit a bid.

**Project Description:**
------------------------

Parks Canada is seeking a contractor to provide winter abrasives production services. The contractor will be required to crush and prepare 12,000 m3 of abrasives for winter maintenance within Banff National Park. The work will take place at Mannix Pit, just west of Castle Junction on the Trans-Canada Highway.

**Instructions to Bidders:**
---------------------------

This is a two-phase selection process. Bidders responding to this selection process are requested to submit a bid in two phases. The first phase will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second phase will invite the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.

**Requirements:**
----------------

Parks Canada requires that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

**Taxes:**
---------

The project is estimated to be valued between $250,001 and $500,000, and taxes are included in this amount.

**Period of Contract:**
----------------------

The contractor is expected to complete the work by July
